title: Foreigner pleads not guilty to giving DoE officer RM50,000 bribe
desc: Jiang Fanjun is accused of committing the offence along Jalan Zamrud in the Nilai Industrial Area on Feb 12 last year.

title: Govt announces two new specialist schools for complex, high needs
desc: The schools were planned for Palmerston North and South Auckland, regions the Education Minister said had seen increasing demand for specialist education provision.

title: Young Kashmiri shawl seller suffers fractures, head injuries in Uttarakhand mob attack
desc: The association said relatives of the victim informed them that the boy was first questioned about his identity.

title: Police detain couple over murder of nine-year-old daughter in Khwisero, Kakamega
desc: Police say couple kept the body in the house for two days before burying it in a shallow grave

title: 1’ ratings to AFC, flags shareholder concentration risk
desc: S&P Global Ratings has assigned its ‘A’ long-term and ‘A-1’ short-term issuer credit ratings to Africa Finance Corp. (AFC). The outlook is positive.

title: Antidepressant use does not worsen early outcomes after traumatic brain injury
desc: Taking certain antidepressants at the time of a traumatic brain injury (TBI) is not associated with an increased risk of death, brain surgery or longer hospital stays, according to a study published on January 28, 2026, in Neurology, the medical journal of the American Academy of Neurology.

title: Golden State buries Utah 140-124 behind a flurry of 3-pointers
desc: Stephen Curry scored 27 points, Moses Moody had 26 and the Golden State Warriors beat the Utah Jazz 140-124 on Wednesday night. Gui Santos had 16 points off the bench for the Warriors. Golden State made 23 3-pointers and never trailed over the final three quarters.

title: Workplace stress presentations on the rise: Poll
desc: A ‘perfect storm’ of circumstances: GPs report a rise in patients seeking time off for workplace-related mental health issues.
source: Royal Australian College of General Practitioners (RACGP)

title: MBSB expects smartphone industry to experience a challenging 2026
desc: MBSB Research said Thursday that it has maintained its neutral stance on Malaysia's technology sector as it viewed that the smartphone industry is anticipated to experience a challenging 2026.

title: ‘Greatest job in the world’: Buzz retires as journalism great after storied 50-year career — NRL Daily
desc: ‘One of the greats’: Buzz makes surprise call on legendary career in touching message
